page.title: 03WINTER HILL TRANSMITTER
page.content:
From Winter Hill{television}programmes for BBC and ITV are transmitted. This is an example of the{science and {technology}of our time. 19 people work at the{transmitter}. They work from 9.00.a.m. until 5.00.p.m. During the winter months access to the site is often difficult because of heavy snowfalls on this elevated and exposed site.
The{mast}, which is 1015 feet high, has been standing since 1964. It was built on Winter Hill because it is the highest point in the transmitting area. On the site there are several smaller masts which serve the police, British Telecom and Norweb.
In 1958 there was a plane crash on Winter Hill, resulting in the deaths of 34 people.
